Course Description: ADVANCED THEORY AND ACCOUNTING TECHNIQUES FOR THE RECORDING AND REPORTING OF FINANCIAL TRANSACTIONS; INCOME DETERMINATION AND VALUATION PROBLEMS IN ASSET, LIABILITY, AND EQUITY ACCOUNTING.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
UPON COMPLETION OF THIS COURSE, STUDENTS WILL BE ABLE TO:

1.EXPLAIN THE ACCOUNTING CYCLE, ACCRUAL VS. CASH-BASIS ACCOUNTING
2.COMPLETE END OF PERIOD WORKSHEETS
3.PREPARE AN INCOME STATEMENT, RETAINED EARNINGS STATEMENT AND BALANCE SHEET FROM THE END-OF PERIOD WORKSHEETS
4.EXPLAIN AND USE APPROPRIATE NOTES, SCHEDULES, AND SUMMARIES OF ACCOUNTING POLICIES ACCOMPANYING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
5.PREPARE A STATEMENT OF CASH FLOWS, USING EITHER THE DIRECT OR THE INDIRECT METHOD OF PRESENTATION
Textbook(s): STICE, JAMES & STICE, EARL (2009).  INTERMEDIATE ACCOUNTING (17TH ED.). INDEPENDENCE, KY: CENGAGE LEARNING. [ISBN 0-324-59237-X]
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
